means: 使协调，使调和( coordinate的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: Town planning and land allocation had to be coordinated.
sentence.Network_cn: 必须协调城市规划和土地分配之间的关系。

sentence.Network_en: The sound has to be coordinated with the picture.
sentence.Network_cn: 声音必须和画面协调一致.

sentence.Network_en: A fire could have been deliberately started to cloak small coordinated troop movements.
sentence.Network_cn: 可能是有人故意放火掩护小规模的部队协同行动。

协调者（Coordinator）：它是一个FFD节点，负责整个网络的管理工作。每个网络中有只有一个协调者。
网络协调器（coordinator）是一种全功能器件，而网络节点通常为简化功能器件。如果通过网络协调器组建无线传感器网络，整个网 …

entry.def: If you co-ordinate an activity, you organize the various people and things involved in it.

example.ex: Government officials visited the earthquake zone on Thursday morning to co-ordinate the relief effort.
example.tran: 星期四上午，政府官员视察地震灾区，以协调救援工作。

example.ex: ...the setting up of an advisory committee to co-ordinate police work.
example.tran: 建立咨询委员会以协调警务工作

entry.def: If you co-ordinate clothes or furnishings that are used together, or if they co-ordinate, they are similar in some way and look nice together.

example.ex: She'll show you how to co-ordinate pattern and colours...
example.tran: 她会教你如何搭配款式和颜色。

example.ex: Tie it with fabric bows that co-ordinate with other furnishings...
example.tran: 系上与其他装饰相配的布质蝴蝶结。

entry.def: Co-ordinates are pieces of clothing or soft furnishings which are similar and which are intended to be worn or used together.
If you co-ordinate the different parts of your body, you make them work together efficiently to perform particular movements.

example.ex: They spend several weeks each year undergoing intensive treatment which enables them to coordinate their limbs better.
example.tran: 他们每年都花费几周的时间接受强化治疗，以使四肢能够更好地协调。

entry.def: The co-ordinates of a point on a map or graph are the two sets of numbers or letters that you need in order to find that point.

example.ex: Can you give me your co-ordinates?
example.tran: 您能告诉我您的坐标吗？

example.ex: ...the latitude and longitude co-ordinates of any location in the world.

means.word_mean: 2. being dexterous in the use of more than one set of muscle movements;

sentences.sentence: "she was usually good with her hands and well coordinated"- Mary McCarthy
